page.title: 03ALEXANDRA PARK - OLDHAM
page.content: Built by unemployed cotton workers and opened in 1865,the park was named after Princess Alexandra. It was "for the people of Oldham for ever" and cost Â£31,000 to build. It contains a boating lake, duck pond, greenhouses, paddling pool, crazy golf course, bowling greens, and tennis courts. Statues include the famous "Blind Joe" and there are many open grassy spaces and seasonal flower displays. The boating lake was built in 1903 at a cost of Â£14,000. It had to be repaired in 1983 _ water was disappearing but nobody knew where to! It cost Â£440,000 to solve the problems. Every August the Oldham carnival takes place in the park. There is a procession through the town that finishes at the park gates.
